videoData.title: How data is driving the future of fashion
videoData.socialTitle: How data is driving the future of fashion

nodes.whoTheyAre: Steve Brown began his career in the fashion industry making photocopies. Fifteen years later, Brown was on the team while working for Ben Sherman Accessories that won a Maxim Brand of the Year award, worked on the DKNY global Menswear labels, and helped set up the buying department for Calvin Klein Menswear. He has a bachelor’s degree in Design Management and Communications, from Birmingham Institute of Art and Design, enjoys competing with his twin, and he believes that everything happens for a reason.

videoData.description: The fashion industry is on the brink of a revolution. Today, designers have the latest trends at their fingertips with data gathered from Instagram feeds, runway shows and even changing rooms. But if the future of fashion design is dedicated to data, does that mean the death of true creativity? Fashion buyer Steve Brown argues for the opposite: that with more efficient production cycles, designers are free to focus on what they love.
videoData.socialDescription: The fashion industry is on the brink of a revolution.
